a chart of all of the

1244.51.text:
over the past few days with you

I've noticed that
in all of our data,

1253.29.text:
Avalon Dive Park, the green,

1263.96.text: these are the 2 that are fish,

1266.70.text:
there are definitely a
lower amount of them because,

1269.47.text:
well, I know that the
dive park is protected,

1272.60.text:
but that doesn't mean that when
they're out of the dive park,

1275.91.text:
when they get fish,
it doesn't really

1278.31.text:
give them a chance

Right, they're not always

1284.18.text:
They can move in and out--
that's a great observation.

1286.78.text:
(Meg)
Also we talked
about the weather

1289.22.text:
and how that could've been
a large factor of why

1292.72.text:
we did not see many of these
invertebrates, the urchins,

1295.89.text:
gorgonians, cucumbers,
because it was so surgy.

1298.06.text:
And also with
the Avalon Dive Park,

1301.67.text:
that could've kicked up
the bottom.

1305.10.text:
So that could've hurt

1307.24.text:
(Colleen)
Do you know what
urchins primarily eat?

1311.34.text:
(Colleen)
Great! So these guys are pretty
much sitting on the bottom.

1313.91.text:
They're never going to be
swimming around

1315.85.text:
in the water at all,
and they're eating seaweed.

1318.32.text:
Most of the time they're just
going to eat drift seaweed

1320.55.text:
that's kind of broken off
and is drifting by

1322.72.text:
and they could
just eat it that way.

1325.02.text:
Another indicator species
is the California sheephead.

1326.52.text:
Any guesses what
these guys might eat?

1330.56.text:
(Colleen)
Yup, they're
going to eat urchins.

1332.40.text:
When the sheephead
get to be pretty big,

1336.67.text:
They also eat other hard things
like crabs and things like that.

1339.77.text:
So if we fish out
a lot of our sheephead,

1342.37.text:
if we reduce the
numbers of sheephead,

1344.04.text:
what's going to happen
to our other populations?

1346.31.text:
The urchin is going
to grow numerously,

1348.61.text:
and then it's going to
eat all the giant kelp,

1352.12.text:
and then the giant kelp
is going to go down,

1356.42.text:
then any animal that eats
giant kelp is going to die

1359.99.text:
because they don't
have any food.

1362.03.text:
(Meg)
Plus giant kelp also give
shelter to many animals.

1364.86.text:
So if the kelp
and the sheephead--

1366.87.text:
it's kind of like
a domino effect.

1369.27.text:
So it's all interrelated...
That's what I was gonna say.

1372.00.text:
the domino effect--
if we take one,

1374.31.text:
even just one piece
of this giant web out of order,

1377.78.text:
then we're going to have
implications down the line.
